00037 /**
00038  * \file seriesAnalyzer.c
00039  * \brief reads in series and does some analyses on them.
00040  *
00041  * $Source: /usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/tools/seriesAnalyzer.c,v $
00042  * $Revision: 1.28 $
00043  * $Date: 2006/08/30 19:20:04 $
00044  *
00045  * \description
00046  *   Given an inputfile containing the datafilenames it
00047  *   reads in series from file and does some analyses on them.
00048  *   Wired into the code right now is the option of doing the calcs
00049  *   on the data itself, or on its normal form.
00050  *   MinMax and integral on each. Euclidean distance 
00051  *   and dimensionless area between all pairs.
00052  *
00053  *  commented out - prints file of normal form of data set and its derivative - see
00054  *   note about this in todo and the normalwriteoutfunction for warning.
00055  *  (der isnt quite right but it jsut means its off by some const)
00056  *
00057  *  Only works on 1 data point 1 component data.
00058  *
00059  *  reads in from inputfile in format:
00060  *   numfiles
00061  *   datafilename1
00062  *   datafilename2
00063  *   datafilenameN
00064  *
00065  *  data files in format:
00066  *   #dataname seqname numseqpts varname  (e.g., can1 displacement 20 Force)
00067  *   time1 val1 
00068  *   time2 val2 
00069  *   time3 valN 
00070  *
00071  *  writes results to "<filename>.out" in format
00072  *   //#regularized intersecting sequences
00073  *   //analyses results - min, max, integral, euc, and klein for
00074  *   //each pair ordered by closest klein
00075  *   //two blank lines at the end of a seq set then start the next one
00076  *
00077  * \modifications
00078  *   - 04/19/05 ACG Created.
00079  *   - 07/21/05 ACG removing gnu option for now
00080  *   - 07/27/05 ACG trimmed mods list so only hot current stuff listed
00081  *   - 07/27/05 ACG parameter passed for derivative is wired into the code.
00082  *   - 07/27/05 ACG having it print out normal forms of data and its derivative for plotting purposes
00083  *
00084  * \todo  
00085  *    - fix normal form of derivative to account for fist and last pts being zero
00086  *    - is there a better way to get the derivative tolerance parameter
00087  *    - change wired in raw data vs normal form option.
00088  *    - relax assumptions on single input data point
00089  *    - more FT (skip over and continue)
00090  *      on missing files or bad files or badnames in inputdeck
00091  */
00092 
00093 #include <fc.h>
00094 #include <math.h>
00095 #include <string.h>
00096 
00097 //globals
00098 FC_Mesh glob_mesh;
00099 FC_Dataset glob_dataset;
00100 int glob_meshDataPoint;
00101 //must be single datapoint single component
00102 int numComponent = 1;
00103 int glob_meshDim = 1;
00104 
00105 
00106 //reading in data
00107 FILE *fp, *fpout, *fpder,*fpgnu, *lfp;
00108 int maxchar = 80;
00109 
00110 typedef enum{
00111   VMAX = 0,
00112   VMIN = 1,
00113   VINT = 2,    
00114   VEUC = 3,
00115   VKLEIN = 4,
00116 } stattype;
00117 
00118 
00119 typedef struct{
00120   char* name; //will be responsible for freeing this memory
00121   //  char* refname; //will be responsible for freeing this memory
00122   double max;
00123   double min;
00124   int maxindex;
00125   int minindex;
00126   double integral;
00127   double eucdist;
00128   double kleindist;
00129 } Stats;

00133 static void statsInit(Stats *x){
00134   x->name = NULL;
00135   //  x.refname = NULL;
00136   x->min = 0.;
00137   x->max = 0.;
00138   x->minindex = 0;
00139   x->maxindex = 0;
00140   x->integral = 0.;
00141   x->eucdist = 0;
00142   x->kleindist = 0;
00143 }

00146 static void setupFiles(char* dirin, char* namein, char* basedir,
00147                        char* filein, char* fileout, char* fileder, char* filegnu){
00148   strcpy(basedir,dirin);
00149   strcat(basedir,"/");
00150 
00151   strcpy(filein, basedir);
00152   strcat(filein, namein);
00153 
00154   strcpy(fileout, filein);
00155   strcat(fileout, ".out");
00156 
00157   strcpy(fileder, filein);
00158   strcat(fileder, ".der");
00159 
00160   strcpy(filegnu, filein);
00161   strcat(filegnu, ".gnu");
00162 
00163   printf("inputfile <%s> outputfile <%s>\n",filein,fileout);
00164   fflush(NULL);
00165 
00166   fp = fopen(filein,"r");
00167   if (fp == NULL){
00168     printf("failed to open input file\n");
00169     fflush(NULL);
00170     exit (-1);
00171   }
00172   fpout = fopen(fileout,"w");
00173   if (fpout == NULL){
00174     printf("failed to open output file\n");
00175     fflush(NULL);
00176     exit (-1);
00177   }
00178   fprintf(fpout, "inputfile <%s> outputfile <%s>\n",filein,fileout);
00179   fflush(NULL);
00180 
00181   fpder = fopen(fileder,"w");
00182   if (fpder == NULL){
00183     printf("failed to open derivative file\n");
00184     fflush(NULL);
00185     exit (-1);
00186   }
00187   /*
00188   fpgnu = fopen(filegnu,"w");      
00189   if (fpgnu == NULL){
00190     printf("failed to open gnu output file\n");
00191     fflush(NULL);
00192     exit (-1);
00193   }
00194   */
00195 }

00198 static void setupDataset(int k){
00199   //parameter doesnt matter
00200 
00201   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00202   double* glob_meshcoords;
00203   int i =k;
00204 
00205   //make a data set to play in
00206   rc = fc_createDataset("glob dataset", &glob_dataset);
00207   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "abort: failed to create dataset");
00208 
00209   //make a mesh
00210   rc = fc_createMesh(glob_dataset," glob mesh", &glob_mesh);
00211   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "abort: failed to create mesh");
00212   //make mesh coords - doesnt matter what these values are
00213   //hand these off to the mesh
00214   glob_meshcoords = (double*) malloc(glob_meshDataPoint*sizeof(double));
00215   for (i = 0; i < glob_meshDataPoint; i++){
00216     glob_meshcoords[i] = (double)i;
00217   }
00218   rc = fc_setMeshCoords(glob_mesh, glob_meshDim, glob_meshDataPoint,
00219                         glob_meshcoords);
00220   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "abort: failed to set vertex coords");
00221 
00222   free (glob_meshcoords);
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 static int readOneData(int id, int* numSeqStep,
00227                      FC_Sequence* seq, FC_Variable** seqVar){
00228   //read in data. exits entirely if there is problem
00229 
00230   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00231   int i,k;
00232   int ii = id;
00233   char dataname[maxchar];
00234   char name[maxchar];
00235   char seqname[maxchar];
00236   char varname[maxchar];
00237   double* timecoords;
00238   double* data;
00239 
00240   //   #dataname seqname numseqpts varname  (e.g., can1 displacement 20 Force)
00241 
00242   //read in data
00243   fscanf(lfp,"#%s %s %d %s\n",dataname,seqname,&numSeqStep[ii],
00244          varname);
00245   printf("dataname = %s seqname = %s numStep = %d varname = %s\n",
00246          dataname,seqname,numSeqStep[ii],varname);
00247   fprintf(fpout,"dataname = %s seqname = %s numStep = %d varname = %s\n",
00248           dataname,seqname,numSeqStep[ii],varname);
00249   fflush(NULL);
00250 
00251   //the memory for these gets handed off
00252   timecoords = (double*)malloc(numSeqStep[ii]*sizeof(double));
00253   data = (double*)malloc(numSeqStep[ii]*sizeof(double));
00254   
00255   //now read in its data
00256   for (i = 0; i < numSeqStep[ii]; i++){
00257     if (fscanf(lfp,"%lg %lg\n",&timecoords[i],&data[i]) !=2){
00258       printf("error in input data format");
00259       fprintf(fpout, "error in input data format");
00260       fflush(NULL);
00261       exit (-1);
00262     }
00263   }
00264 
00265   // Create the sequence
00266   strcpy(name,dataname);
00267   strcat(name,"_");
00268   strcat(name,seqname);
00269   rc = fc_createSequence(glob_dataset, name, &seq[ii]);
00270   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to create sequence");
00271   rc = fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr(seq[ii], numSeqStep[ii],
00272                                FC_DT_DOUBLE, (void*)timecoords);
00273   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to set time values");
00274   
00275   //create seq var
00276   rc = fc_createSeqVariable(glob_mesh,seq[ii],dataname,&k,&seqVar[ii]);
00277   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to create sv1");
00278   
00279   for (i = 0; i < numSeqStep[ii]; i++){
00280     rc = fc_setVariableData(seqVar[ii][i],glob_meshDataPoint,
00281                             numComponent,
00282                             FC_AT_VERTEX,FC_MT_SCALAR,
00283                             FC_DT_DOUBLE,
00284                             &data[i*glob_meshDataPoint*numComponent]);
00285     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to set data for sv");
00286   }
00287   free (data);
00288 
00289   return 1;
00290 }
00291 
00292 
00293 static int readData(char *basedir, int numSeq, int* numSeqStep,
00294                     FC_Sequence* seq, FC_Variable** seqVar){
00295   int i = 0;
00296   char lfilein[maxchar];
00297 
00298   while(fscanf(fp,"%s\n",lfilein) && i < numSeq){
00299     char fname[maxchar];
00300     strcpy(fname,basedir);
00301     strcat(fname,lfilein);
00302 
00303     lfp = fopen(fname,"r");
00304     if (lfp == NULL){
00305       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to open input file %s", lfilein);
00306       i++;
00307       return 0; //make this more robust to missing files later
00308       //      continue;
00309     }
00310     //now read in sets of data
00311     if (readOneData(i,numSeqStep,seq,seqVar) == 0){
00312       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to read input file %s", lfilein);
00313       return 0;
00314     }
00315     fclose(lfp); 
00316     i++;
00317   }
00318   
00319   fclose(fp);
00320   return 1;
00321 }
00322 
00323 
00324 static int makeIntersecting(double tmin, double tmax, int numSeq,
00325                              int* numSeqStep, FC_Sequence* seq, FC_Variable** seqVar,
00326                              int*  numStepIntersect, FC_Sequence* seqintersect,
00327                              FC_Variable** seqVarIntersect){
00328   //make comparison seqs over teh range
00329   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00330   int i, ii;
00331 
00332 
00333   printf("Making Intersecting SeqVars.....\n");
00334   fflush(NULL);
00335 
00336   //default
00337   *numStepIntersect = 0;
00338 
00339   //first get intersecting sequence
00340   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmin,0.0) && FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmax,0.0)){
00341     //then do it for the whole range
00342     rc = fc_createIntersectingRegularSequence(numSeq,seq,0,
00343                                               "seqintersect", seqintersect);
00344     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00345       fprintf(fpout,"Can't get intersecting range over whole range - exiting\n");
00346       fflush(NULL);
00347       fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "Can't get intersecting range over whole range - exiting\n");
00348       return 0; //this wont matter
00349     }
00350 
00351   } else {
00352     //do it for the bounds
00353     rc = fc_createIntersectingRangeRegularSequence(numSeq,seq,tmin,tmax,
00354                                                    "seqintersect", seqintersect);
00355     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00356       fprintf(fpout,"Can't get intersecting range over this range\n");
00357       printf("Can't get intersecting range over this range\n");
00358       fflush(NULL);
00359       return 0;
00360     }
00361   }
00362 
00363   rc = fc_getSequenceNumStep(*seqintersect,numStepIntersect);
00364   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00365     fprintf(fpout,"failed to get numsteps on new seq\n");
00366     printf("failed to get numsteps on new seq\n");
00367     fflush(NULL);
00368     fc_deleteSequence(*seqintersect);
00369     return 0;
00370   }
00371   
00372   //now put them all on the same seq
00373   for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00374     char *name1, *name2;
00375     
00376     //now get linear interpolation 
00377     rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVar[ii][0],&name1);
00378     name2 = (char*)malloc((strlen(name1))+5*sizeof(char));
00379     strcpy(name2,name1);
00380     strcat(name2,"_new");
00381     rc =  fc_linearInterpolation (numSeqStep[ii], seqVar[ii], *seqintersect,
00382                                   name1,&seqVarIntersect[ii]);
00383 
00384     free(name1);
00385     free(name2);
00386     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00387       fprintf(fpout,"failed to do linear interpolation\n");
00388       printf("failed to do linear interpolation\n");
00389       fflush(NULL);
00390       //clean up all the ones weve made so far
00391       for ( i = 0; i <= ii; i++){
00392         rc = fc_deleteSeqVariable(*numStepIntersect,seqVarIntersect[i]);
00393       }
00394       return 0;
00395     }
00396   }
00397 
00398   return 1;
00399 }
00400 
00401 
00402 static int makeNormal(int numStepIntersect, 
00403                        int numSeq, FC_Variable **seqVarIntersect, 
00404                       FC_Variable **seqVarIntersectNormal){
00405   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00406   int i,ii;
00407 
00408 
00409   printf("Making NormalForms of Intersecting SeqVars.....\n");
00410   fflush(NULL);
00411   for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00412     char *name1,*name2;
00413 
00414     rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVarIntersect[ii][0],&name1);
00415     name2 = (char*)malloc((strlen(name1))+5*sizeof(char));
00416     strcpy(name2,name1);
00417     strcat(name2,"_N");
00418 
00419     rc = fc_normalForm(numStepIntersect,seqVarIntersect[ii],name2,&seqVarIntersectNormal[ii]);
00420     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00421       fprintf(fpout,"#error:cant get normalform for this var\n");
00422       fflush(NULL);
00423       //clean up all the ones weve made so far
00424       for ( i = 0; i <= ii; i++){
00425         rc = fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStepIntersect,seqVarIntersectNormal[i]);
00426       }
00427       free(name1);
00428       free(name2);
00429       return 0;
00430     }
00431 
00432 
00433     free(name1);
00434     free(name2);
00435   }
00436   return 1;
00437 }
00438 
00439 static void doSingles(int numStepIntersect,int numSeq, FC_Variable** seqVarIntersect,
00440                       Stats** svstats){
00441   //do stats that are on individual sequence vars
00442   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00443   int ii;
00444 
00445   printf("Performing Single Seq Analyses\n");
00446   fflush(NULL);
00447   for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00448     FC_Variable minvar, maxvar, minindexvar, maxindexvar, integralvar;
00449     double *mindata, *maxdata, *integraldata;
00450     int *minindexdata, *maxindexdata;
00451     char* vname;
00452     
00453     rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVarIntersect[ii][0],&vname);
00454     rc =  fc_getSeqVariableSeriesMinMax (numStepIntersect, seqVarIntersect[ii],
00455                          &minvar, &maxvar, &minindexvar,
00456                          &maxindexvar); 
00457     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get minmax for sv");
00458     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(minindexvar,(void**)&minindexdata);
00459     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get min indexvariable data");
00460     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(minvar,(void**)&mindata);
00461     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get min variable data");
00462     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(maxindexvar,(void**)&maxindexdata);
00463     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get max indexvariable data");
00464     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(maxvar,(void**)&maxdata);
00465     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get max variable data");
00466     
00467     rc = fc_integral_TR(numStepIntersect, seqVarIntersect[ii],
00468                                     "intvar",&integralvar);
00469     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get integral for sv");
00470     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(integralvar,(void**)&integraldata);
00471     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get integral data");
00472 
00473 
00474     //fill in stats
00475     (*svstats)[ii].name = (char*)malloc((strlen(vname)+1)*sizeof(char));
00476     strcpy((*svstats)[ii].name,vname);
00477     //know only 1DP 1component data
00478     (*svstats)[ii].min = mindata[0];
00479     (*svstats)[ii].max = maxdata[0];
00480     (*svstats)[ii].minindex = minindexdata[0];
00481     (*svstats)[ii].maxindex = maxindexdata[0];
00482     (*svstats)[ii].integral = integraldata[0];
00483     
00484 
00485     //clean up
00486     free(vname);
00487     fc_deleteVariable(minvar);
00488     fc_deleteVariable(maxvar);
00489     fc_deleteVariable(minindexvar);
00490     fc_deleteVariable(maxindexvar);
00491     fc_deleteVariable(integralvar);
00492   }
00493 
00494 }
00495 
00496 
00497 static void doDoubles(int numStepIntersect,FC_Variable *seqVarref, FC_Variable *seqVarcomp,
00498                       Stats *statscomp){
00499 
00500   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00501   double *data1, *data2;
00502   FC_Variable euc_var, area_var;
00503 
00504   printf("Performing Comparison Seq Analyses\n");
00505   fflush(NULL);
00506   //    svstats[ii].refname = (char*)malloc((strlen(name1))*sizeof(char));
00507   //    strcpy(svstats[ii].refname,name1);
00508   
00509   //first do euclidean distance
00510   rc =  fc_euclideanDistanceBetweenCurves(numStepIntersect, seqVarref,
00511                                           seqVarcomp,
00512                                         "euc_dist", &euc_var);
00513   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to calc euclidean dist");
00514   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(euc_var,(void**)&data1); //know this is a double
00515   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get euclidean dist data");
00516         
00517   //now do area between curves
00518   rc =  fc_dimensionlessAreaBetweenCurves (numStepIntersect,
00519                                                seqVarref,seqVarcomp,
00520                                                "euc_dist", &area_var);
00521   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to calc dimensionless area");
00522   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(area_var,(void**)&data2); //know this is a double
00523   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get euclidean dist data");
00524         
00525   //single component, single data point
00526   statscomp->eucdist = data1[0];
00527   statscomp->kleindist = data2[0];
00528         
00529   //clean up
00530   fc_deleteVariable(euc_var);
00531   fc_deleteVariable(area_var);
00532 }
00533 
00534 
00535 static int origWriteout(int numSeq, int* numSeqStep,
00536                          FC_Sequence* seq, FC_Variable **seqVar){
00537   //writeout of orig data for gnuplot. gnuplot file is based on filein, not fileout!
00538   //if there is an error in there then it jus aborts on the writeout, btu the program continues.
00539 
00540   char *name;
00541   double *dataa, *coords;
00542   int i, ii;
00543   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00544   int ret = 1;
00545   
00546   fprintf(fpout,"\n\n#Orig sequences\n");
00547   fflush(NULL);
00548   for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00549     rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVar[ii][0],&name);
00550     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00551       fprintf(fpout,"#error:cant get name for this var\n");
00552       fflush(NULL);
00553       ret = 0;
00554       continue;
00555     }
00556     fprintf(fpout,"#%10s\n ",name);
00557     fflush(NULL);
00558     //    fprintf(fpgnu,"%s \"%s\" index %d title \"%s\" with lines\n",
00559     //      (ii == 0 ? "plot": "replot"),filein,ii,name);
00560     
00561     free(name);
00562     
00563     rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(seq[ii],(void**)&coords);
00564     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00565       fprintf(fpout,"#error:cant get coords for this var\n");
00566       fflush(NULL);
00567       ret = 0;
00568       continue;
00569     }
00570     
00571     for (i = 0; i < numSeqStep[ii]; i++){
00572       rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(seqVar[ii][i],(void**)&dataa);
00573       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00574         fprintf(fpout,"#error:cant get variable data\n");
00575         fflush(NULL);
00576         ret = 0;
00577         break;
00578       }
00579       //know its one data point one component
00580       fprintf(fpout,"%10g %10g\n",coords[i],dataa[0]);
00581       fflush(NULL);
00582     }
00583     fprintf(fpout,"\n\n");
00584     fflush(NULL);
00585   }
00586 
00587   return ret;
00588 }
00589 
00590 
00591 static void writeoutCompare(int numStepIntersect, FC_Sequence seqintersect, 
00592                                  int numSeq, FC_Variable **seqVarIntersect){
00593   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00594   char *name;
00595   double *dataa, *coords;
00596   int i,ii;
00597 
00598 
00599   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(seqintersect,(void**)&coords);
00600   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get seq coords");      
00601   fprintf(fpout,"\n\n#Time Range: %10g - %10g\n",coords[0],coords[numStepIntersect-1]);
00602   printf("\n\n#Time Range: %10g - %10g\n",coords[0],coords[numStepIntersect-1]);
00603   fprintf(fpout,"#comparison sequences\n#%9s ","time");
00604   fflush(NULL);
00605   //      printf("#comparison sequences\n#%9s ","time");
00606   for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00607     rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVarIntersect[ii][0],&name);
00608     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get var name");
00609     fprintf(fpout,"%10s ",name);
00610     //  printf("%10s ",name);
00611     fflush(NULL);
00612     free(name);
00613   }
00614   fprintf(fpout,"\n");
00615   //      printf("\n");
00616   fflush(NULL);
00617   
00618   for (i = 0; i < numStepIntersect; i++){
00619     fprintf(fpout,"%10g ", coords[i]);
00620     //  printf("%10g ", coords[i]);
00621     fflush(NULL);
00622     for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00623       rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(seqVarIntersect[ii][i],(void**)&dataa);
00624       fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get variable data");
00625       //know its one data point one component
00626       fprintf(fpout,"%10g ",dataa[0]);
00627       //          printf("%10g ",dataa[0]);
00628       fflush(NULL);
00629     }
00630     fprintf(fpout,"\n");
00631     //  printf("\n");
00632     fflush(NULL);
00633   }
00634   fprintf(fpout,"\n\n");
00635   //      printf("\n\n");
00636   fflush(NULL);
00637 }

00644   //recall that derivative is given as zero for the first two vals and last two vals

00720 
00721 static void writeoutChart(int kk, char* name1, FC_Sequence seqintersect, int numSeq, Stats* svstats){
00722   //now output chart of quantities - write them in order of increasing klein dist
00723   //to the ref one
00724 
00725   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00726   int i, j, tmp;
00727   int order[numSeq];
00728   double* coords;
00729 
00730   //get order
00731   for (i = 0; i < numSeq; i++){
00732     order[i] = i;
00733   }
00734   
00735   //  printf("sorting....");
00736   for (i=0; i < numSeq-1 ; i++) {
00737     for (j=0; j < numSeq-1-i; j++){
00738       if (fabs(svstats[order[j+1]].kleindist)
00739           < fabs(svstats[order[j]].kleindist)) {  /* compare the two neighbors */
00740         tmp = order[j];         /* swap a[j] and a[j+1]      */
00741         order[j] = order[j+1];
00742         order[j+1] = tmp;
00743       }
00744     }
00745   }
00746   //  printf("done\n");
00747 
00748 
00749   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(seqintersect,(void**)&coords);
00750   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get seq coords");      
00751   
00752  
00753   //writeout
00754   fprintf(fpout,"#%14s: %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s\n",
00755           "NAME", "MIN", "MINTIME", "MAX", "MAXTIME", "INTEGRAL",
00756           "EUCDIST", "KLEINDIST");
00757   printf("#%14s: %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s %10s\n",
00758          "NAME", "MIN", "MINTIME", "MAX", "MAXTIME", "INTEGRAL",
00759          "EUCDIST", "KLEINDIST");
00760   
00761   fprintf(fpout,"REF= %10s: %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g\n",
00762           svstats[kk].name, svstats[kk].min, coords[svstats[kk].minindex],
00763           svstats[kk].max, coords[svstats[kk].maxindex],svstats[kk].integral);
00764   printf("REF= %10s: %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g\n",
00765          svstats[kk].name, svstats[kk].min, coords[svstats[kk].minindex],
00766          svstats[kk].max, coords[svstats[kk].maxindex],svstats[kk].integral);
00767   fflush(NULL);
00768   for (i = 0; i <numSeq; i++){
00769     int ii = order[i];
00770     if (strcmp(svstats[ii].name,name1)!=0){//same as if ii DNE kk
00771       fprintf(fpout,"%15s: %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g\n", 
00772               svstats[ii].name, svstats[ii].min, coords[svstats[ii].minindex],
00773               svstats[ii].max, coords[svstats[ii].maxindex], svstats[ii].integral,
00774               svstats[ii].eucdist, svstats[ii].kleindist);
00775       printf("%15s: %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g %10g\n",
00776              svstats[ii].name, svstats[ii].min, coords[svstats[ii].minindex],
00777              svstats[ii].max, coords[svstats[ii].maxindex], svstats[ii].integral,
00778              svstats[ii].eucdist, svstats[ii].kleindist);
00779       fflush(NULL);
00780     }
00781   }
00782   fprintf(fpout,"\n");
00783   printf("\n");
00784   fflush(NULL);
00785 }
00786 
00787 
00788 //------------------------------------------MAIN---------------------------------//
00789 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00790   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00791   int i, ii, kk;
00792   int ret;
00793 
00794   //seqvars
00795   int numSeq;
00796   FC_Variable **seqVar;
00797   int *numSeqStep;
00798   FC_Sequence *seq;
00799 
00800   //looping
00801   int validbounds = 1;
00802   double tmin = 0.;
00803   double tmax = 0.;
00804   //  int iteration = 0;
00805 
00806   char filein[maxchar],fileout[maxchar],fileder[maxchar],filegnu[maxchar], basedir[maxchar];
00807 
00808   //get filename
00809   if (argc != 3) {
00810     printf("usage: seriesAnalyzer inputDir inputFile\n");
00811     fflush(NULL);
00812     exit(-1);
00813   }
00814 
00815   //-----------------------------FILES---------------------------------------//
00816   setupFiles(argv[1], argv[2], basedir, filein, fileout,fileder,filegnu);
00817 
00818   //------------------------- FC SETUP--------------------------------------//
00819   rc = fc_setLibraryVerbosity(FC_ERROR_MESSAGES);
00820   rc = fc_initLibrary();
00821   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to initialize fc library");
00822 
00823   
00824   glob_meshDataPoint =1;
00825 
00826   setupDataset(3); //set up dataset, mesh etc. these vals dont matter
00827 
00828   //------------------------ORIG DATA--------------------------------------//
00829   //get number of datafiles
00830 
00831   fscanf(fp,"%d\n",&numSeq);
00832   if (numSeq < 1){
00833     fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid numseq");
00834     return 0;
00835   }
00836     
00837   //allocate out here so not passing *** 
00838   seq = (FC_Sequence*)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(FC_Sequence));
00839   numSeqStep = (int*)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(int));
00840   seqVar = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
00841 
00842   i = readData(basedir,numSeq,numSeqStep,seq,seqVar);
00843   if (i == 0){
00844     fc_printfErrorMessage("prob reading data - exiting" );
00845     return 0;
00846   }
00847 
00848   //--------------------WRITE OUT ORIG DATA  --------------------------//
00849   //dont care if there is an error in writeout
00850   ret = origWriteout(numSeq,numSeqStep,seq,seqVar);
00851   //07/21/05 ACG removing gnu option for now
00852   //  ret = origWriteout(filein,numSeq,numSeqStep,seq,seqVar);
00853   //  fclose(fpgnu);
00854 
00855 
00856   //---------------------------------ANALYSES LOOP-------------------------------//
00857   //now loop thru - analyses are repeatable over different ranges
00858   while (validbounds){
00859   //analyses
00860     int numStepIntersect;
00861     FC_Sequence seqintersect;
00862     FC_Variable **seqVarIntersect, **seqVarIntersectNormal;
00863     FC_Variable **seqVarCompare;
00864     Stats* svstats;
00865 
00866     seqVarIntersect = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
00867     seqVarIntersectNormal = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
00868     seqVarCompare = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
00869     svstats = (Stats*)malloc(numSeq*sizeof(Stats));
00870     for (i = 0; i < numSeq; i++){
00871       statsInit(&svstats[i]);
00872     }
00873 
00874     //----------------PUT THEM ON SAME SEQ FOR COMPARISONS---------------------//
00875     ret = makeIntersecting(tmin, tmax, numSeq, numSeqStep,seq, seqVar, &numStepIntersect,
00876                      &seqintersect, seqVarIntersect);
00877 
00878     if (ret == 0){
00879       printf("ERROR: cant process these bounds. Continue with new bounds.\n");
00880       fprintf(fpout,"#ERROR: cant process these bounds.\n");
00881       fflush(NULL);
00882     } else {
00883       //makes normal forms of the intersecting seqvars
00884       ret = makeNormal(numStepIntersect,numSeq,seqVarIntersect,
00885                        seqVarIntersectNormal);
00886       if (ret == 0){
00887         printf("ERROR: cant process these bounds. Continue with new bounds.\n");
00888         fprintf(fpout,"#ERROR: cant process these bounds.\n");
00889         fflush(NULL);
00890         exit(-1);
00891       } else {
00892         
00893         //decide which set we are going to use
00894         for (i = 0; i < numSeq; i++){
00895           seqVarCompare[i] = seqVarIntersectNormal[i];
00896         }
00897 
00898         //---------------WRITEOUT INTERSECTING SEQS---------------------//
00899         writeoutCompare(numStepIntersect, seqintersect, numSeq, seqVarCompare);
00900 
00901         //---------------------------------ANALYSES----------------------------------//
00902 
00903         //get min and max and integral on the intersecting range:
00904         doSingles(numStepIntersect,numSeq,seqVarCompare,&svstats); //sinlges
00905 
00906         /*
00907         //FIX  - pass normal in now that im calculating it
00908         if (iteration == 0){
00909           //only do this the first time. it closes fpder
00910           writeoutNormal(numStepIntersect,seqintersect, numSeq, seqVarIntersect);
00911           iteration++;
00912         }
00913         */
00914         
00915         //now do euclidean distance and dimensionless area
00916         //take each one as the reference one in turn:
00917         for (kk = 0; kk < numSeq; kk++){
00918           char* name1;
00919           rc = fc_getVariableName(seqVarCompare[kk][0],&name1);
00920           fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "failed to get var name");
00921           
00922           for (ii = 0; ii < numSeq; ii++){
00923             if (ii == kk) continue;
00924             doDoubles(numStepIntersect,seqVarCompare[kk],seqVarCompare[ii],
00925                       &(svstats[ii])); //comparisons
00926           }
00927         
00928           //----------------------WRITEOUT CHART----------------------------------//
00929           writeoutChart(kk, name1, seqintersect, numSeq, svstats);
00930         
00931           //clean up for this iteration of ref variable
00932           free(name1);
00933         }
00934       }
00935 
00936 
00937       //clean up for all iterations
00938       for (i = 0; i< numSeq; i++){
00939         fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStepIntersect,seqVarIntersect[i]);
00940         fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStepIntersect,seqVarIntersectNormal[i]);
00941         free(seqVarIntersect[i]);
00942         free(seqVarIntersectNormal[i]);
00943         free (svstats[i].name);
00944         //      free (svstats[i].refname);
00945       }
00946       //inner one is just a pointer
00947       //do we need to delete the seq var ?
00948       free(seqVarCompare);
00949       
00950       fc_deleteSequence(seqintersect);
00951     }
00952     free (seqVarIntersect);
00953     free (seqVarIntersectNormal);
00954     free (svstats);
00955 
00956     //----------------------GET NEW BOUNDS-----------------------------------------------//
00957     validbounds = 0;
00958     while (!validbounds){
00959       printf("Enter new Tmin and Tmax. Use 0 0 to do calc over entire range. Use -1 -1 to exit.\n");
00960       //      printf("You can load %s in gnuplot to see the full range of data curves.\n",filegnu);
00961       fflush(NULL);
00962       scanf("%lf %lf",&tmin,&tmax);
00963       if (tmin < tmax || (FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmin,0.0) && FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmax,0.0))){
00964         validbounds = 1;
00965       } else {
00966         if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmin,-1.0) && FC_DBL_EQUIV(tmax,-1.0)){
00967           printf("Exiting\n");
00968           fflush(NULL);
00969           break; //this should break out of while
00970         } else {
00971           printf("Invalid bounds\n");
00972           fflush(NULL);
00973         }
00974       }
00975     }
00976     if (!validbounds){
00977       //exiting
00978       break;
00979     }
00980   }
00981 
00982   //final clean up
00983   fclose(fpout);
00984 
00985   for (i = 0; i< numSeq; i++){
00986     fc_deleteSeqVariable(numSeqStep[i],seqVar[i]);
00987     free(seqVar[i]);
00988     fc_deleteSequence(seq[i]);
00989   }
00990 
00991   free (numSeqStep);
00992   free (seq);
00993   free (seqVar);
00994 
00995   fc_deleteMesh(glob_mesh);
00996   fc_deleteDataset(glob_dataset);
00997 
00998   fc_finalLibrary();
00999   exit(0);
01000 
01001 }
